page.title: 05EMPLOYMENT IN BROMYARD
page.content: In the{Bromyard}area there is more {unemployment}than there should be, but the problem is not as bad as it is elsewhere. During the last twenty years the main types of employment have changed. In 1966, 50% of the school leavers found jobs in{agriculture.}Now most leavers find employment in {local service}and{manufacturing {industries.}Nevertheless a considerable number still find work in agriculture. As there is so much agriculture in the area there is much seasonal employment such as{strawberry and{hop-picking. Over half the 16-year olds from the Queen Elizabeth High School in Bromyard go on to{further education; either in Hereford or Worcester. Of the other half, only six were left without employment in 1984.
